Class KeyGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • KeyGenerator

  • public class KeyGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The KeyGenerator class is responsible for generating an encryption key (or "codex" as it is referred to within the program) text file containing a series of randomly generated numbers that meet parameters (such as complexity of randomly generated number or amount of randomly generated numbers) which are specified by the user. All user defined variables are from the RunOneTimePadHardUI class
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey
    See Also:
    RunOneTimePadHardUI

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> codex
      ArrayList of Integers containing all randomly generated values read in from the encryption key file.
      private int codexComplexity
      User specified integer which sets the largest number the random number generator can create
      private int codexLength
      User specified integer which dictates how many randomly generated numbers the key file should contain.
      private java.lang.String filePath
      User specified String giving the file path to the key file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeyGenerator()
      No argument constructor
      KeyGenerator(int codexLength, int codexComplexity, java.lang.String filepath)
      Constructor used when generating a new encryption key.
      KeyGenerator(java.lang.String filePath)
      Constructor used when a new encryption key does not need to be generated.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.lang.String getFilePath() 
      void printCodex()
      Prints all values from the encryption key text file to the console.
      void printToTxtDoc()
      Generates and prints random integers (within the users predefined parameters) to the text document at a user specified file path.
      void retrieveCodexDoc()
      Reads in all integers from the encryption key text file and places them in an ArrayList of Integers.

    • Field Detail

      • codex

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> codex
        ArrayList of Integers containing all randomly generated values read in from the encryption key file.

      • codexLength

        private int codexLength
        User specified integer which dictates how many randomly generated numbers the key file should contain.

      • codexComplexity

        private int codexComplexity
        User specified integer which sets the largest number the random number generator can create

      • filePath

        private java.lang.String filePath
        User specified String giving the file path to the key file. If a text file does not already exist it will create one. Default file location is within kdorcey_swd folder

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyGenerator

        public KeyGenerator(int codexLength,
                    int codexComplexity,
                    java.lang.String filepath)
        Constructor used when generating a new encryption key. It is used to establish the length of the encryption key, complexity of th key (maximum randomly generated number and file path to the encryption key text file.
        Parameters:
        codexLength - User specified integer to determine amount of random numbers to generate in the encyption key.
        codexComplexity - User specified integer used to determine the largest random variable that the class can generate.
        filepath - User specified String used to set the filepath to where the encryption key text file will be generated.

      • KeyGenerator

        public KeyGenerator(java.lang.String filePath)
        Constructor used when a new encryption key does not need to be generated.
        Parameters:
        filePath - User specified String used to find the already generated encryption key.

      • KeyGenerator

        public KeyGenerator()
        No argument constructor

    • Method Detail

      • getCodex

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getCodex()
        Returns:
        returns all randomly generated integers from the encryption key file in the form of an ArrayList of Integers.

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Returns:
        returns String containing the filePath of the encryption key

      • printToTxtDoc

        public void printToTxtDoc()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Generates and prints random integers (within the users predefined parameters) to the text document at a user specified file path. Only used if a new encryption key text file is generated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException when the user's filepath is unreachable.

      • retrieveCodexDoc

        public void retrieveCodexDoc()
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads in all integers from the encryption key text file and places them in an ArrayList of Integers. Used when generating a new encryption key and when using a preexisting one.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws FileNotFoundException if encryption key file is not found

      • printCodex

        public void printCodex()
        Prints all values from the encryption key text file to the console.
